sect2.title: Overview
sect2.para: The &application; window enables you to display and play your favorite music. Figure 1 shows the &application; window displaying the library.

sect2.title: The Side Pane

textobject.phrase: Shows side pane with library and &playlist; icons.

sect2.para:
The side pane is where you can access your music library internet radio and your &playlist; .The side pane can contain the following icons:
The &application; library, where all of the imported songs will appear.
Any &playlist; that have been created from imported songs.
Listen to Internet Radio stations.

sect2.title: The Player Area
sect2.para: The 'player' area provides access to details about the currently playing track. When a track is not being played, this area shows no information. When 'Play' is selected, the track name is displayed, and underneath, the artist and the album names.
A tracker is also displays, showing the progress of the playing. When tracker has focus, the arrow keys can be used to Fast-Forward or Rewind the playing track.

tip.para: Clicking on the artist or album name (where they are underlined) will load the appropriate 'allmusic.com' page.
If you are using a mouse with a scroll wheel, you can adjust the volume by scrolling up or down while the mouse pointer is over the volume button.

sect2.title: Playing Music
sect2.para: To play a track, either select the track and press the Play button on the toolbar, or simply double-click on the track to start playing.
When track ends, &application; jump to play next track in the list showed in view pane.
In Library you can play all song from an artist or a single album simply select Album or Artist entry in library browser.

sect3.title: Shuffle
sect3.para: When this option is selected, the tracks in the browser are played in 'random' order.

sect3.title: Repeat
sect3.para: When this option is selected, when the last track in the browser is played, the list is repeated from the beginning.

sect3.title: Next/Play/Previous
sect3.para: The Next and Previous buttons can be used to skip between tracks whilst playing. If a song is currently playing, the previous button will restart the song. Clicking on the Play button will start &application; playing the current track. Whilst playing this will change to a Pause icon.

sect3.title: Volume Control
sect3.para: volume control in the right hand of the player area. Clicking on the loudspeaker icon will show the volume slider. Sliding this up and down will increase and decrease the volume. The loudspeaker icon will change to reflect the relative volume.

sect2.title: The Library
sect2.para: The &application; Library is an organized view of your music files. You can browse the Library by artist or by album. Once you have added a song to your Library you can play it directly or add it to a &playlist; to be played as part of a playlist.
Choose OrganizeAdd to Library... to add music files to &application; Library. If you select a folder, all music file in all subfolders will be added to Library.

warning.para: The library is located in the .gnome2/rhythmbox directory in your home directory. It is unique for each user on your system.
If you delete or move this directory a new, empty library will be created when the application is next opened.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
sect3.para:
A song can be added to the library in a few ways, as shown below;
Choose OrganizeAdd to Library...
Drag and drop from other applications. eg. Nautilus
Opening a song/directory from Nautilus with &application;, using the context menu.
The &application; context menu in Nautilus.

sect3.title: Deleting Songs
sect3.para: To delete songs from the library, simply select the song then choose EditDelete item or press the Delete key.
Once the last entry of an album (or artist) is deleted, the appropriate entry is also deleted from Library browser.

sect3.title: Using the Browser
sect3.para: The Browser allows the library to be easily browsed, showing the artist, then album of the current track. It is not shown when viewing a &playlist;. Choose ViewBrowser to change browser visibility.

When started, the browser defaults to viewing all artists, and all tracks. Selecting an individual artist will change the Album list to show all albums by this artist, and the track list changes to show all tracks for these albums. Selecting an album will change the track list to show only the contents of this album.

sect3.title: Properties
sect3.para: Choose EditProperties to view the properties of a particular track .

The Basic tab shows the details of the song, as Title, Artist, Date.
Basic song properties

The Details tab of the dialog shows more detailed information about the file itself and its encoding. It also shows the associated with the file.
Details song properties

sect3.title: Searching
sect3.para: To search the &application; library for a particular word or phrase, type into the search field, and the view will show all the entries that have the search criteria will be shown the in the tracks list.

sect2.title: Statistics
sect2.para: &application; can maintain statistics on the use of the library. &application; automatically records the number of plays, the last played date and allows you to rating each track. You can access this information through Additional tab in dialog for each song or directly in the View Pane for all songs displayed in Library or &playlist;; you can add proper columns via the dialog.

sect3.title: Ratings
sect3.para:
This allows each song in the library to be rated on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. To rate a song:
Select the song, choose EditProperties, select Details tab, click in different part of Rating entry to set required rating
Click in different parts of the Rating column in View Pane to set the required rating.

sect3.title: Number of plays
sect3.para: Each time a track has completed playing, its play count is incremented by 1. This will allow the most popular songs in the library to be easily identified.

sect3.title: Last played time
sect3.para: When the play count is incremented, the last played time is also recorded.

sect2.title: Playlists
sect2.para: A &playlist; is an ad hoc list that has been created from songs in &application; library, to have a different sorting method from artist/album library default.
It might consist of a list of songs of a particular 'genre', a specific group of artists, or even songs that are of a particular 'mood', or whatever you want.
To display the contents of a &playlist;, simply click on the required icon in side pane, and the view pane will change to show the contents.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
sect3.para: To create a &playlist; use one of the following methods:

itemizedlist.listitem: Drag a 'track', 'album' or 'artist' from library or library browser to the side pane. When the &playlist; is created, it will default to either the name of the artist (when dropping an artist), the name of the album (when an album), or when a track is dropped, a dialog is displayed, prompting for the name of the group (which is by default named 'Untitled').
Choose OrganizeNew Group. Again a dialog is displayed prompting for a name, and if any tracks are selected, tick the Add selected track option box to add them to the group.

sect3.para: To add songs, album or artist to an already existing group just drag and drop it from the library to the &playlist;''s icon in the side pane.

sect3.title: Deleting Songs
sect3.para: To delete songs from a &playlist;, simply select the song then choose EditDeleteEdit or simply press the Delete key.

sect3.title: Modifying a &playlist;
sect3.para: Right click on group icon in Side Pane to display the group menu. This will allow the renaming and deletion of the &playlist;. Selecting the Rename will display a prompt for the new name of the group. Selecting the Delete will delete the &playlist; (note that the 'content' of the &playlist; is not removed from the library, just the 'playlist'.

sect3.title: Listening via Internet
sect3.para: The Internet Radio tuner can be used to listen to streamed audio files.

sect3.title: Adding a station
sect3.para: New stations can be added to the Internet Radio tuner, using the Add New Internet Radio Station menuoption.

sect2.title: Panel Applet
sect2.para: The Notification Area is a Gnome feature that allows applications to add a small icon to the panel while the program is running. &application; adds it''s icon to the notification area and this allows you to control &application; from your tray.
Using the &application; icon in the notification area, the following commands can be sent to the application:

itemizedlist.listitem: Play | Pause — Play or Pause the currently selected song. This item changes depending on whether a song is playing or not.
Previous — Skip to previous song in playlist.
Next — Skip to next song in playlist.
Show Window — choose whether or not the &application; window is visible or not.

tip.para: If you are using a mouse with a scroll wheel, you can adjust the volume by scrolling up or down while the mouse pointer is over the panel applet.

sect1.title: Customizing &application;
sect1.para: You can customize &application; to suit your requirements and preferences. This section describes how to customize &application;.

sect2.title: Preferences
sect2.para: Using the Preferences dialog you can customize how you want &application; to look. To display the Preferences dialog, choose EditPreferences .

sect3.title: Columns
sect3.para: This section of the dialog allows you to select which columns will be displayed.

sect3.title: Browser preferences
sect3.para: This section of the dialog allows you to select how the browser will be displayed.
